page.title: 12FARMING IN WENSLEYDALE
page.content: Douglas started farming in 1956 and he has seen many changes. When he began, heavy horses were used in this area; now there are no horses. He has three 4-wheel drive tractors. Silage has changed winter feeding; the self-feed silage face saves a lot of work. Stone field barns are typical of our area; they were used until recently for storing hay and for milking. Cows were milked by hand and milk was carried in back-cans to churns near the farm entrance. The churns were emptied daily by the Creamery. Now many of the barns are unused and are becoming derelict. There are suggestions of converting some barns into homes.One of the greatest recent changes is in farm buildings which are now clustered around the farmhouse.The milking is done by machine in milking-parlours and is piped untouched into a tank.
